text.section:
In this section, "charitable institution" means an institution:
that is located in Montgomery County or Prince George's County; and
whose purpose is primarily charitable.

Except as provided in subsection (c) of this section, if a charitable institution does not discriminate against the entrance or care of residents of Montgomery County or Prince George's County, the Commission:
shall supply without cost up to 100 gallons of water per day for each resident of the charitable institution; and
may not charge the charitable institution a fee for sewer usage for the water supplied under item (1) of this subsection.

section.section: The charitable institution shall install and maintain a water meter at its own cost.

The Commission may charge the charitable institution for:
the cost of reading the water meter; and
sewer usage and water used in excess of 100 gallons per day for each resident of the charitable institution.
